main event: In April 1956, a civilian in Liberty, Missouri reported an observation of 1,500 objects near Venus, including 50-100 lights and one stationary saucer with blue lights, approximately 100 feet in diameter.
interesting points: The witness, a 14-year-old civilian, reported observing the objects through a small telescope, making the accuracy of the sighting questionable.
The letter from Lt. Colonel Timothy R. Johnson indicates that the report was forwarded for further investigation and evaluation to the Air Technical Intelligence Center.
Another sighting report from April 6, 1956, described a round, white, glowing object with a black ring around it, estimated to be 100 feet in size, traveling at approximately 1,500 mph.
The object was observed to give a whistling sound and appeared to be flat on the bottom and rounded on top, resembling a saucer.
The witness reported clear sky conditions and good visibility, with the object passing silently and swiftly from south to north or northeast.
sighted object: 1,500 objects near Venus, including a stationary saucer with blue lights
